pages.title: Data Cable
pages.text: The backbone of any computing infrastructure. The Data Cable is a hybrid conduit capable of interfacing with both internal machines and external power sources.$(br)$(br)It provides a bidirectional link: delivering energy to your hardware and retrieving computational $(l:logicore:architecture/cycles)Cycles$() in return.

pages.title: Network Topology
pages.text: Data Cables handle network creation automatically.$(br)$(br)Placing a cable in isolation instantiates a new, unique network. However, placing a cable adjacent to an existing line will cause it to merge instantly with that network.$(br)$(br)Use this to link power generators to your $(l:logicore:machines/server_rack)Server Racks$() and $(l:logicore:machines/computer)Computers$().
Cheap and efficient, these cables allow for complex routing between your power generation and your server room.
